Description: Fragment of lower wall of Attic red-figured pottery krater; inside glazed, fired red; outside, above stopt maeander band, symposium: remaining are a leg of the kline, one of the trapeza, and a boot beneath.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 99 no. 341 pl. 73)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1005)
